reasoning: Hypertensive encephalopathy is a specific complication of hypertensive crisis. US data shows incidence range of 3.3-6.2 per 100k (2006-2013), with estimates suggesting 15% of hypertensive emergencies. Using conservative midpoint estimate of ~4.7 per 100k. Data quality moderate due to varying estimates and potential coding practice changes over time.
source: US hospital data (2006-2013) showing incidence range 3309-6178 per million cases; French nationwide cohort study (2023) of 7769 patients with HE
